text: My daughter has been in Kuno Method for nearly 2 years. We found that the lesson is effective in building up her logic thinking and mathematics skills, and now she is in P1 and is able to cope well in her mathematics.

Both of my children (aged 5 and 3) started going to KUNO at the age of 18 months and 28 months. Each session was designed to be both educational and enjoyable, and my children always look forward to the class.

The students are taught not to just know the facts but to understand, apply, and extend to real scenarios. I definitely noticed significant growth in my child’s problem-solving abilities, creativity, and confidence to speak.

My elder one joined the class since 3 years old and he love the class so much , after attending the class I feel he boost the creativity of thinking and well with numbers. My younger one also just started this year N1 class he love to attend the class as well.
Very catchy way for kids to learn, effective for those whose attention span are short.. it’s a pity that there’s only one centre.

Quality preschool enrichment class. It's not those right brain training. In fact I think it's more logical reasoning training.

The founder is a Japanese expert and he believes in building a good foundation to prepare kids for primary school. That's why the program is only for preschoolers.

The class typically starts with a quick play to warm up. Teaching is generally fun for little ones. Class is modern and clean. The notes and worksheets is amazing. They are all good quality and in colors! A lot of these schools will just print notes in b/w.
